paragraphs: Gisborne, or T큰ranganui-a-Kiwa in M훮ori, is a region rich in M훮ori history and culture. It was one of the first areas settled by Polynesian voyagers and is associated with early waka landings.
Gisborne is famously the first place Captain James Cook set foot in New Zealand in 1769. European settlers later developed the region for farming and horticulture.
Today, Gisborne is known for its strong M훮ori identity, beautiful beaches, and as the first city in the world to see the sunrise. It is also a hub for wine production and surfing.
